intro: Carex bonanzensis, commonly known as the Bonanza sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spike of small, three-lobed flowers that are usually greenish or brownish in color. Carex bonanzensis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
